pullRequest.body:
`Polynomial.coeffList` is the list of coefficients, in descending order from leading term to constant term. (The zero polynomial has coeffList of `[]`). The PR defines coeffList and proves some basic facts, notably relating `P.coeffList` to `P.eraseLead.coeffList`.

messageFile.md
So the stuff in EraseLead and Unbundled was all from #9082 and #9083, which this was building on, it had just been so long I forgot which was where. I cleared that out from this commit

Thanks for the review, I'll get through them today/tomorrow I expect. The main reason I wanted it as a list is because I was primarily concerned with the effect of `eraseLead`, multiplying by linear functions, etc. which I think are most naturally viewed as a list (equivalent to taking a tail of a list, etc.). I wanted it "downward" because this matches, imo, mathematical convention: we talk about the _leading_ coefficient, and erase_Lead_, and this makes sense to have this at the _head_ of the list. It's also more awkward to talk about dropping the last element of a list as opposed to dropping the first.

If you strongly feel that one of these is the wrong decision, let me know and I can look at changing it, but I think this is the most natural form
I don't feel very strongly either way, but I do feel very strongly that this should be documented somewhere! Maybe this could go in the docstring of `coeffList`?

I integrated the feedback, but I didn't change it to `WithBot.succ` ... I think it makes it messier in a number of ways. (Like, I think there's more API around the support and natDegree that simplifies out nicely?) I could be convinced otherwise but when I tried it, it wasn't looking very friendly
I introduced `WithBot.succ` a month ago ðŸ˜… so I think it's worth trying to add API if you see some missing. Do you have concrete painpoint examples?

messageFile.md
Thanks! A first batch of comments below - please don't take them as discouraging.
So the stuff in EraseLead and Unbundled was all from #9082 and #9083, which this was building on, it had just been so long I forgot which was where. I cleared that out from this commit

Thank you for the PR! Here are a few comments. Note that you might need to merge master to access `WithBot.succ`.

Could you please also explain why
1. You want this as a list rather than eg a sequence or finite sequence
2. It should go downward rather than upward

Thanks for the review, I'll get through them today/tomorrow I expect. The main reason I wanted it as a list is because I was primarily concerned with the effect of `eraseLead`, multiplying by linear functions, etc. which I think are most naturally viewed as a list (equivalent to taking a tail of a list, etc.). I wanted it "downward" because this matches, imo, mathematical convention: we talk about the _leading_ coefficient, and erase_Lead_, and this makes sense to have this at the _head_ of the list. It's also more awkward to talk about dropping the last element of a list as opposed to dropping the first.

If you strongly feel that one of these is the wrong decision, let me know and I can look at changing it, but I think this is the most natural form
I don't feel very strongly either way, but I do feel very strongly that this should be documented somewhere! Maybe this could go in the docstring of `coeffList`?

I integrated the feedback, but I didn't change it to `WithBot.succ` ... I think it makes it messier in a number of ways. (Like, I think there's more API around the support and natDegree that simplifies out nicely?) I could be convinced otherwise but when I tried it, it wasn't looking very friendly
I introduced `WithBot.succ` a month ago ðŸ˜… so I think it's worth trying to add API if you see some missing. Do you have concrete painpoint examples?
